title: ICE: failed while formatting fluent string

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: regression-from-stable-to-stable
labels.description: Performance or correctness regression from one stable version to another.

labels.name: A-translation
labels.description: Area: Translation infrastructure, and migrating existing diagnostics to SessionDiagnostic

body:
I ran into this error while working on a rust bevy app. I boiled it down to this minimal example. ### Code ```Rust use bevy::prelude::*; #[derive(Component)] pub struct Animations<'a> { current_animation: &'a str, } pub fn animation_system(mut animation_query: Query<(&mut Animations, &mut Handle)>) {} fn main() { App::new() .add_startup_system(setup) .add_system(animation_system) .run(); } fn setup(mut commands: Commands, asset_server: Res) { commands.spawn(Camera2dBundle::default()); } ``` ### Meta `rustc --version --verbose`: ``` rustc 1.68.0 (2c8cc3432 2023-03-06) binary: rustc commit-hash: 2c8cc343237b8f7d5a3c3703e3a87f2eb2c54a74 commit-date: 2023-03-06 host: x86_64-pc-windows-msvc release: 1.68.0 LLVM version: 15.0.6 ``` ### Error output ``` thread 'rustc' panicked at 'called `Result::unwrap()` on an `Err` value: failed while formatting fluent string `infer_but_needs_to_satisfy`: the fluent string has an argument `has_param_name` that was not found. help: the arguments `has_lifetime`, `lifetime` and `spans_empty` are available ', compiler\rustc_errors\src\emitter.rs:1391:84 stack backtrace: note: Some details are omitted, run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=full` for a verbose backtrace. error: internal compiler error: unexpected panic note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug. note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/new?labels=C-bug%2C+I-ICE%2C+T-compiler&template=ice.md note: rustc 1.68.0 (2c8cc3432 2023-03-06) running on x86_64-pc-windows-msvc note: compiler flags: --crate-type bin -C embed-bitcode=no -C debuginfo=2 -C incremental=[REDACTED] note: some of the compiler flags provided by cargo are hidden query stack during panic: #0 [check_well_formed] checking that `animation_system` is well-formed #1 [check_mod_type_wf] checking that types are well-formed in top-level module #2 [analysis] running analysis passes on this crate end of query stack error: internal compiler error: no warnings or errors encountered even though `delayed_good_path_bugs` issued error: internal compiler error: trimmed_def_paths constructed but no error emitted; use `DelayDm` for lints or `with_no_trimmed_paths` for debugging | = note: delayed at 0: std::backtrace::Backtrace::disabled 1: std::backtrace::Backtrace::force_capture 2: ::fmt 3: ::fmt 4: >::msg 5: ::emit_raw_bytes 6: >::msg 7: >::msg 8: ::print_def_path 9: ::print_def_path 10: ::has_non_const_dtor 11: ::fmt 12: ::try_report 13: ::try_report_nice_region_error 14: ::check_region_obligations_and_report_errors 15: rustc_hir_analysis::check::intrinsic::check_platform_intrinsic_type 16: ::visit_lifetime 17: ::encode_alloc_id 18: ::new_min 19: ::pointer_sized 20: rustc_hir_analysis::check::intrinsic::check_platform_intrinsic_type 21: ::encode_alloc_id 22: as rustc_privacy::VisibilityLike>::new_min 23: ::try_mark_green 24: ::visit_ty 25: ::visit_expr 26: rustc_hir_analysis::hir_wf_check::provide 27: rustc_hir_analysis::check_crate 28: rustc_interface::passes::analysis 29: ::encode_alloc_id 30: as rustc_privacy::VisibilityLike>::new_min 31: ::try_mark_green 32: ::new 33: rustc_driver::args::arg_expand_all 34: ::new 35: ::new 36: ::new 37: ::new 38: std::sys::windows::thread::Thread::new 39: BaseThreadInitThunk 40: RtlUserThreadStart note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug. note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/new?labels=C-bug%2C+I-ICE%2C+T-compiler&template=ice.md note: rustc 1.68.0 (2c8cc3432 2023-03-06) running on x86_64-pc-windows-msvc note: compiler flags: --crate-type bin -C embed-bitcode=no -C debuginfo=2 -C incremental=[REDACTED] note: some of the compiler flags provided by cargo are hidden query stack during panic: end of query stack thread panicked while panicking. aborting. error: could not compile ```
Backtrace

``` ```
